message: Estate planning presents the potential for various intrafamilial conflicts that attorneys must be capable of spotting and handling ethically in their practices.

Youâ€™re invited to join Leah Del Percio, attorney and founder of Trustate, as she discusses how attorneys can employ strategies to mitigate conflicts in a members-only presentation on Friday, November 3, 2023, at 3:00 p.m. ET./12:00 p.m. PT.
This presentation is approved for one hour of Legal Ethics MCLE credit in California.
*Please note: While all Justia Connect members are invited to attend our free webinars, you must upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to be eligible to earn MCLE credit.
Estate planning presents the potential for various intrafamilial conflicts that attorneys must be capable of spotting and handling ethically in their practices.

Please join Leah Del Percio, attorney and founder of Trustate, as she discusses effective strategies to mitigate conflicts during Estate Planning in a members-only presentation on Friday, November 3, 2023, at 3:00 p.m. ET./12:00 p.m. PT.
This presentation is approved for one hour of Legal Ethics MCLE credit in California.
*Please note: While all Justia Connect members are invited to attend our free webinars, you must upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to be eligible to earn MCLE credit.
Reminder: You are registered for Navigating & Mitigating Ethical Conflicts in Estate Administration & Planning today at 3:00 p.m. ET/12:00 p.m. PT.
